pullRequest.body:
This PR mostly consists of the lemmas related to `Order.height`, `Order.coheight`, and `krullDim` appearing in the process of working on PR #21041. We thought that the lemmas may be useful to other PRs (like #22127 perhaps?), so we decided to open it into a separate PR to accelerate the review process.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

#### Declarations diff

`+ coheight_eq_krullDim_Ici`
`+ finiteDimensionalOrder_iff_krullDim_ne_bot_and_top`
`+ height_eq_krullDim_Iic`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

@YaelDillies I'm sorry, but how exactly should I run this? Sorry for being not very familiar with these actions. Thanks for your help!

> > Can you run `scripts/add_deprecations.sh`? Thanks!
> > maintainer delegate
> 
> @YaelDillies I'm sorry, but how exactly should I run this? Sorry for being not very familiar with these actions. Thanks for your help!

You can do it locally on your computer. Here are the results
```
Processing Mathlib/Order/KrullDimension.lean
Processing Mathlib/Order/RelSeries.lean

`Mathlib/Order/RelSeries.lean` deprecations:
1: @[deprecated (since := "2025-03-01")]||||alias nonempty_of_infiniteDimensionalType := nonempty_of_infiniteDimensionalOrder

```
OK! Thanks a lot for that! Should I add that line to the file manually? Or does it automatically modifies the files and you can directly commit the changes? @riccardobrasca

> OK! Thanks a lot for that! Should I add that line to the file manually? Or does it automatically modifies the files and you can directly commit the changes? @riccardobrasca

Yes, the script does it for you. Just run `scripts/add_deprecations.sh` inside the mathlib folder and then commit normally.
Thanks! Added now!

Can you run `scripts/add_deprecations.sh`? Thanks!

maintainer delegate
Is there an `Î±` already in scope?
You're right, fixed this now!
Does this already exist somewhere? If not we probably want it.
I didn't find similar things using the loogle query `Order.krullDim, Order.height` .
I mean the `iso`, not the theorem itself. `OrderIso.refl _` should work.
You're right! It worked!
Is this line needed?
Can you use the `:=` notation instead of `@`?
Can you use it directly in the `rw`?
It worked as well. Thanks for the suggestion!

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
    exact le_iSup (fun p â†¦ (p.length : â„•âˆž)) q
```

```suggestion
lemma height_eq_krullDim_Iic (x : Î±) : (height x : â„•âˆž) = krullDim (Set.Iic x) := by
```
If you want.

```suggestion
    Â· exact (fun h1 â†¦ False.elim (h (LTSeries.nonempty_of_finiteDimensionalType Î±)))
```

```suggestion
  obtain âŸ¨p, _âŸ© := (Rel.finiteDimensional_iff r).mp â€¹_â€º
```

```suggestion
  obtain âŸ¨p, _âŸ© := (Rel.finiteDimensional_iff _).mp â€¹_â€º
```
Also, this can be an instance I think.

```suggestion
    FiniteDimensionalOrder Î± â†” krullDim Î± â‰  âŠ¥ âˆ§ krullDim Î± â‰  âŠ¤ := by
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma krullDim_of_isSimpleOrder {Î± : Type*} [PartialOrder Î±] [BoundedOrder Î±]
```

```suggestion

```
I thought this one should be named to the line above (`nonempty_of_infiniteDimensionalType`)?
Or should I rename the other one as well?
Yes, please rename the one above too ðŸ™

pullRequest.title: feat(Order/KrullDimension): some lemmas relating `Order.height`, `Order.coheight` and `krullDim`

source.title: feat(RingTheory/Ideal): more lemmas about the height of an ideal
Tracking issue: dimension theory of (commutative) rings
